message.content:
cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.CV. 

The paper proposes a novel model-based policy search algorithm for reinforcement learning in robotics, which involves learning a dynamical model of the robot and optimizing a policy to maximize the expected return given the model and its uncertainties. This falls under the intersection of several sub-fields in computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), robotics (cs.RO), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), control systems (cs.SY), and computer vision (cs.CV). Given the focus on reinforcement learning in robotics, cs.LG and cs.RO are the most likely sub-categories, followed by cs.AI and cs.SY. The use of computer vision may also be relevant in the context of robotic perception.
